definitions.definition: To be under an obligation to give something back to someone or to perform some action for someone.
examples: We owe it to our children to make our nation a better place to live in the future.
I owe Kevin five bucks which he lent to me last week.
This time I'll cover for you, but now you owe me a favour.

definitions.definition: To have debt ; to be in debt.
To have as a cause; used with to .
examples: The record owes its success to the outstanding guitar solos.

main_definition: ( ditransitive ) To be under an obligation to give something back to someone or to perform some action for someone.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To have debt ; to be in debt.
( transitive ) To have as a cause; used with to .
